author: mac daddyy

text: Of the past 3 elder scrolls game (I'm pretending online doesn't exist) I rank morrowind #1. Sure skyrim and oblivion made some improvements but I'll take having my own custom frenzy spell that can make an entire town level itself over your pre-fashioned frenzy spell that only affects one target for the sake of some animation that'll get old in about 3 seconds.

author: Lucien Lachance

text: I personally played Morrowind after Oblivion and found it much different. I wish that I played it back when it first came out, but one things is for certain, every time I played it after that I just spend countless hours exploring and going aimlessly. It would not have been half the experience if it was not for this music.
author: LightFykki

text: Morrowind still has the best OST of any Elder Scrolls title in my opinion. I was a bit young when it came out so I never got far in the game itself, but the music always pulled me into the world in a wonderful way. Jeremy Soule is very good at that. :D

author: Rex Vigilanti

text: I don't think I'll ever get the kind of magical feeling games like this or the first Asheron's Call/Everquest gave me all those years ago. Exploring big open worlds back then was still very new to me and quite mind boggling. It felt like I was being transported into a second life; I was in awe of everything around me. For me, part of Morrowind's success came from your character's ascension: it all starts very slowly, having trouble killing even the weakest monsters, then ending up with godly powers after days and days of playtime. Jeremy Soule's music is a very big part of this game's magic. I want to replay it someday with the Overhaul mod which looks superb.
author: SupraDarky

text: I love the music from this series.  This song is so incredibly atmospheric and soothing.  This might be a stretch, but I really think Jeremy Soule is the John Williams of modern video game music.  His compositions especially his later soundtracks like the Elder Scrolls series are so incredibly mind-blowing.  Also let's not forget that Soule excels at making atmospheric soundtracks for video games like Secret of Evermore and Dungeon Siege.  Listening to this song makes me want to listen to the other games from this series.
author: Eric C.

text: @Eric C. His resume` is impressive! The list of games!
author: David Harris

text: The overhaul is just beautiful, it's definately worth experiencing, My only gripe with the game these days is the combat system, it feels absolutely archaic to me.
author: IHeart16Bit

text:
@IHeart16Bit
It is, but thankfully Morrowind is part of the old family of RPGs where it's okay to not concern yourself much with combat.  Also, just give new players the advice to be a mage, and they'll never know the difference haha.
